intro: Sopubia lemuriana, commonly known as the Madagascar starflower, is a flowering plant native to Madagascar. It belongs to the family Campanulaceae and is characterized by its star-shaped, violet-blue flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments within the rainforests of the island. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and have a smooth texture. Sopubia lemuriana is noted for its ornamental value and is sometimes cultivated in botanical gardens.
